content.text:
# 2024 Democrats Abroad presidential primary

Biden prevailed in all areas(Americas, Asia-Pacific and EMEA)
| image1 = File:Joe Biden presidential portrait (cropped).jpg
| image_size = x160px
| candidate1 = Joe Biden
| color1 = 224192
| home_state1 = Delaware
| popular_vote1 = 6,907
| percentage1 = 80.1%
| delegate_count1 = 13
| image2 = File:NOTA Option Logo 3x4.svg
| candidate2 = Uncommitted
| color2 = 000000
| home_state2 = –
| popular_vote2 = 1,136
| percentage2 = 13.2%
| delegate_count2 = 0
| image3 = File:Marianne_Williamson_(48541662667)_(cropped).jpg
| colour3 = e05a9d
| candidate3 = Marianne Williamson
| home_state3 = Washington, D.C.
| popular_vote3 = 575
| percentage3 = 6.7%
| delegate_count3 = 0
| reporting =
| last_update =
| time_zone = EDT
| outgoing_members = HI
| elected_members = GA
}}
The 2024 Democrats Abroad presidential primary took place from March 5, 2024, to March 12, 2024, allowing U.S. citizens residing outside the United States and those officially affiliated with Democrats Abroad to participate in the Democratic Party primaries for the 2024 presidential election. The 2024 Democrats Abroad primary allocated a total of 21 delegates to the 2024 Democratic National Convention. The contest began on March 5, 2024, and ended on Super Tuesday alongside primaries in 16 other states and territories. Official results of the primary were released on March 19, 2024. President Biden won in a landslide, though Uncommitted did win 6 countries, while Marianne Williamson won 1.
Candidates
The following candidates were certified to appear on the ballot for Democrats Abroad.
* Joe Biden
* Marianne Williamson
* Uncommitted
Endorsements
* Luiz Inácio Lula da Silva, President of Brazil (2003–2010, 2023–present) ''(Workers' Party)
* Micheál Martin, Taoiseach (2020–2022, 2025-present); former Tánaiste (2022–2025) (Fianna Fáil)''
}}
}}
